page.title: 14Religion - Silloth
page.content: There are five churches in Silloth,and one in West Silloth, the {Pentecostal, whose building used to belong to the Church of England. In 1870, the Church of England built {Christ Church,}half- way along Criffel St., overlooking the Green. The Vicar is Rev. P. Tompkins. About 70 attend Sunday morning service and about 20 in the afternoon, unless there is a special service. The number increases in summer with the influence of tourists. ( This applies to all the churches.) It is built in a Victorian "Gothic" style of sandstone, granite and brick. Recently a lot of money had to be raised for repairs to the bell- tower and walls. {St. Andrew's }is the {Presbyterian }church built in 1886, of brick, in Solway St. Mr. Warren is the minister, and the church elders help him to run it. About 30 people attend the service at 10.30 each week.{Cont'd
